0x0005.name: Special Commands
0x0005.extraWarning: These commands can affect device operation and should be used carefully.

0x0010.name: Locking Error History
0x0010.usedIn: Older systems hold this error list while newer systems use 0x00C2 and/or 0x00C6 and 0x00C7
0x0010.description: Holds the history of locking errors

0x0011.name: Blocking Error History
0x0011.usedIn: Older systems hold this error list while newer systems use 0x00C2 and/or 0x00C6 and 0x00C7
0x0011.description: Holds the history of blocking errors

0x0012.name: Blocking actual system error history
0x0012.usedIn: Older systems hold this error list while newer systems use 0x00C0 and 0x00C1
0x0012.description: Holds the history of blocking errors of the system

0x0013.name: System error history
0x0013.usedIn: Older systems hold this error list while newer systems use 0x00C0 and 0x00C1
0x0013.description: Holds the history of system errors

0x0026.name: EMS service tool heating parameters
0x0026.description: This telegrams contains HT3 configuration parameters for Netcom service tools

0x0027.name: EMS service tool dhw parameters
0x0027.description: This telegrams contains HT3 configuration parameters for Netcom service tools

0x00BF.name: Local error list
0x00BF.usedIn: Used in systems that use the 0x00C2/0x00C6/0x00C7 error history lists
0x00BF.description: The lists holds up to three active errors, sorted by critically

0x00C0.name: System error history
0x00C0.description: Hold the history of errors. 0x00C0 holds the first 10 error messages and 0x00C1 the next 10. Error #1 is the most recent one. Going down the list the errors get older. Older systems use telegrams 0x0012 and 0x0013

0x00C2.name: Local device error history
0x00C2.description: Hold the history of errors. Each device has itÂ´s own list of own errors. Error 1 is the most recent one. Going down the list the errors get older. Older systems use telegrams 0x0010 and 0x0011.

0x00C6.name: Local heat pump error history
0x00C6.description: Hold the history of errors. Error 1 is the most recent one. Going down the list the errors get older. This list is the same as 0x00C2, but has a unique identified at the beginning of each error. This list has 10 entries and is continued in 0x00C7. Older systems use telegrams 0x0010 and 0x0011.

0x00C7.name: Local heat pump error history
0x00C7.description: This list is the continuation of 0x00C6. Here are the errors 11 ... 20 stored. Older systems use telegrams 0x0010 and 0x0011.

0x0165.name: HMI800 holiday mode parameters / Older Junkers heating circuit control
0x0165.usedIn: Buderus/Bosch RC300, HMC310 and similar, newer Junkers controllers "Cxyz" (MY>2019) / older Junkers controllers "Fxyz" (MY<2019)
0x0165.description: Up to 8 holiday periods can be defined with the above telegrams / Up to 10 heating circuits can be controller with these telegrams. 0x0165=HC1, 0x0166=HC2, ...

0x016F.name: FX100 Monitor heating circuit values
0x016F.description: Junkers monitor values of heating circuit. 10 heating circuits can be monitored

0x02A5.name: NSC controller CH monitor for HCx
0x02A5.description: Monitor values for HC1, HC2, ... HC8

0x02C3.name: NSC Clock Program 1 for HCx
0x02C3.description: Sets heating level switch points for HC1, HC2, ... HC8

0x02FF.name: NSC Clock Program for dhw
0x02FF.description: Sets dhw switch points for DHW1 and DHW2

0x0309.name: NSC Clock Program for circulation pump for dhwx
0x0309.description: Sets dhw circulation pump switch points for DHW1 and DHW2

0x0449.name: NSC Clock Program 2 for HCx
0x0449.description: Sets heating level switch points for HC1, HC2, ... HC8

0x0683.name: NSC Clock Program 3 for HCx
0x0683.description: Sets heating level switch points for HC1, HC2, ... HC8

0x068D.name: NSC Clock Program 4 for HCx
0x068D.description: Sets heating level switch points for HC1, HC2, ... HC8

0x02CC.name: DHW priority for unmixed heating circuit
0x02CC.description: Enables/disables dhw priority in unmixed circuits where HC1 is directly connected to the heat source

0x02CD.name: DHW priority for mixed heating circuit HC1, ..., HC8
0x02CD.description: Enables/disables dhw priority in unmixed circuits where HC1 is directly connected to the heat source

0x031D.name: Monitoring DHWx
0x031D.description: Monitors the values of DHW1, DHW2

0x043F.name: NSC HolidayMode for HCx
0x043F.description: Sets start and end date for holiday mode for HC1, HC2, ... HC8

0x048D.name: Heat pump monitor values
0x048D.description: Shows various values of the heat pump

0x04A2.name: Information from the heat pump to the HMI
0x04A2.description: Sends the status of several information from the heat source to the HMI

0x099A.name: Hybrid module monitor
0x099A.description: Monitor data of the hybrid module

0x00FB.name: Write data than be read with telegrams 0x0001 or 0x0003
0x00FB.description: Found by accident. I would be careful with this, no idea what it can cause

0x099C.name: Hybrid-Module Monitor signals for CAN bus
0x099C.distribution: BROADCAST-ON-CHANGE; distribution duration = 60s; timeout = 240s, UNICAST-ON-REQUEST, BROADCAST-PERIODICALLY

0x04AA.name: HP_ENERGYMANAGEMENT_COMPRESSOR_STATUS_MONITORS
0x04AA.description: Monitors for Energy Manager (EM) related to compressor. Dynamic information.

0x0115.name: DHW IMMEDIATELY CONTROL VALUES BETWEEN FX CONTROLLERS.

0x01D3.name: FX MONITOR VALUES FOR DOMESTIC HOT WATER
